page.title: 01SUMMARY ONE
page.content: The area is immediately to the south of the Central Lancashire New Town Development and three miles to the north of the Greater Manchester Boundary.It has been bisected by the M6 Motorway,which has influenced several developments.It lies within the Central Lancashire grass belt;mid way on an East-West axis between the flat arable area and the Pennine foothills. The relief is gently undulating and predominantly rural.The only areas with any high degree of building concentration,are Charnock Richard village,where several private housing estates have been built during thecourse of the last twenty years and Eccleston Green,which is a late nineteenth century development,centered on a now-closed cotton mill.
